categories.name: Historical Women Who Changed the World

questions.clue: In 1955, she refused to give up her seat on a Montgomery bus, sparking the Civil Rights Movement.
This British monarch reigned from 1837 to 1901, making her the longest-serving queen until Elizabeth II.
A Polish-born physicist and chemist, she was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, in 1903.
This Mexican artist is known for her self-portraits and was married to Diego Rivera.
A pioneering computer scientist, she was instrumental in developing the first compiler and the COBOL language.

questions.answer: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

final.clue: This country, the largest in Africa by land area, is home to the Ahaggar Mountains and the Tassili n'Ajjer, known for prehistoric rock art.
